alert.note: Alert for Giles; Montgomery (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 9:20PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Giles and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 915 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm with heavy rain over Pearisburg. This storm was slowly drifting to the southeast toward Blacksburg at 5 miles per hour. HAZARD...Winds up to 30 mph and pea size hail. Heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Combination of the heavy rain and wind could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Greater threat is the localized heavy rain which could significantly reduce the visibility on Highway 460 between Pearisburg and Blacksburg. Heavy rain may also wash debris onto the highway, with poor drainage flooding along driveways and culvert pipes. Locations impacted include... Blacksburg... Pearisburg... Pembroke... Newport... Mountain Lake... Prices Fork... and Eggleston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: A torrential downpour of rain is occuring with the storm. Excessive rainfall may lead to localized flooding with minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
